microstructure: single BCC crystalline structure with a sub-micron grain size of 2-3 m, and small amounts (< 4 vol.%) of fine oxide dispersoids
processing_method: high-energy ball milling and spark-plasma sintering
evidence: Here, CrNbVMo alloy showed a yield strength of 2743 MPa at room temperature. Surprisingly, the yield strength of the CrNbVMo alloy at 1000 • C was 1513 MPa. The specific yield strength of the CrNbVMo alloy was increased by 27 % and 87 % at 25 and 1000 • C, respectively, compared to the AlMo 0.5 NbTa 0.5 TiZr RHEA, which exhibited so far the highest specific yield strength among the cast RHEAs. The addition of Al to CrNbVMo alloy was advantageous in reducing its reduce density to below 8.0 g/cm 3 , while the elastic modulus decreased due to the much lower elastic modulus of Al compared to that of the CrNbVMo alloy.

microstructure: BCC phase with minor oxide inclusions
evidence: The compressive mechanical properties of the alloys are summarized in Table  3 . Despite the single phase nature of the alloys, which lacked hard intermetallic phases, they exhibited outstanding yield strength at room and elevated temperatures (> 2300 and 1000 MPa, respectively). The absence of brittle intermetallic phases explained the moderate fracture strains (> 9.9 %), resulting in a good combination of strength and ductility. The elastic modulus values of the alloys, which were measured by the nanoindentation test, were 217, 208, and 200 GPa for Al 0 , Al 0.5 , and Al 1.0 , respectively (Fig.  S1 ).

the AlxCrNbVMo RHEAs have the highest ss among the BCC RHEAs consisting of a single BCC phase with density below 8.0 g/cm 3

microstructure: homogeneous, without chemical segregation, grain coarsening or micropores. A small amount of oxide inclusions was uniformly formed by in-situ reaction during the PM procedures
evidence: Conclusions Lightweight RHEAs of AlxCrNbVMo (x = 0, 0.5, and 1.0) exhibiting a single BCC phase were fabricated successfully via PM. The microstructures of the bulk alloys were homogeneous, without chemical segregation, grain coarsening or micropores. A small amount of oxide inclusions was uniformly formed by in-situ reaction during the PM procedures. The alloys exhibited superior yield strength and specific yield strength compared to cast RHEAs at 25 and 1000 • C. Particularly, the Al 0 alloy exhibited an outstanding yield strength of 1513 MPa at 1000 • C.
